|Title=Knowing the usual biological markers of alcohol consumption: blood alcohol, GGT, mean blood volume (MBV), desialyzed transferrin, etc.
|Description=The usual markers of alcohol consumption are blood alcohol, gamma GT, MGV and desialylated transferrin.
|Rubric=Additional tests
|Contributors=
|Order=11}}
Usefulness

o Objectivise misuse in cases of denial or minimisation (etiological diagnosis of pancreatitis, etc.)

o Addiction monitoring: identifying relapses, motivational and educational aspects

o Not useful for systematic screening or diagnosis of dependence


Blood alcohol level (breathalyser or blood test)

o useful in emergencies in the event of a fall, malaise, behavioural problems or loss of consciousness

GGT (Gamma Glutamyl Transpeptidase)

o marker of alcohol consumption and alcohol-related liver damage

o poor sensitivity

o poor specificity (to be interpreted in conjunction with the entire liver work-up)

o difficult to interpret if obese or with metabolic syndrome

o decreases from the first week after stopping consumption, and normalises in 4 to 10 weeks.

VGM (Mean corpuscular volume)

o The least sensitive

o fairly specific

o slowly returns to normal (three months after stopping).

CDT (desialylated transferrin)

o Slightly more sensitive than GGT

o very specific

o normalises within a few weeks of stopping consumption

question.title: What is CDT (desialylated transferrin) primarily used for in the context of alcohol consumption?

option_a.title: Systematic screening and diagnosis of dependence
option_a.description: Used in conjunction with other tests to identify dependence

option_b.title: Monitoring relapses and motivational aspects
option_b.description: Used to track relapses and provide educational aspects

option_c.title: Identifying liver damage and monitoring alcohol consumption
option_c.description: Used to assess liver damage and detect alcohol consumption

option_d.title: Monitoring and interpreting blood alcohol levels
option_d.description: Used to determine blood alcohol levels in emergencies

correct_option.title: Identifying liver damage and monitoring alcohol consumption
correct_option.description: Used to assess liver damage and detect alcohol consumption
